EngLawArticles.EngArticleContent: These Standards are prescribed pursuant to Paragraph 2 of Article 104 of the Trademark Act (hereinafter as the Act).

The following are fees of filing an application for registration:
1. for an application for trademark or collective trademark registration, the filing fee to be paid is calculated from each class of the designated goods or services. The amount for each class is calculated according to the following:
(1) for a class in Classes 1 to 34 with 20 designated goods or less in such class, the amount is NT$3,000; for more than 20 designated goods in such class, the amount shall plus NT$200 per designated good over 20 goods;
(2) for a class in Classes 35 to 45, the amount is NT$3,000; for Class 35 with designated retail services of specific goods, the amount shall plus NT$500 per designated retail service of specific goods over 5 retail service of specific goods.
2. for an application for collective mark or certification mark registration, the filing fee is NT$5,000.
When filing an application for registration by electronic means pursuant to Article 13 of the Act, the filing fee referred to in the preceding paragraph shall reduce NT$300 per application; while all of the designated goods or services in such application are identical with the recommended terms in e-filing system, the filing fee shall reduce NT$300 more per class.

The following are fees of renewal:
1. for renewal of a trademark or collective trademark, the fee is NT$4,000 per class;
2. for renewal of a collective mark or certification mark, the fee is NT$4,000.
If a request for renewal is withdrawn before the notice of acceptance has been given, the applicant may request for a refund of the renewal fee referred to in the preceding paragraph.
For a request to issue a replacement registration certificate or re-issue a registration certificate of a registration, the fee is NT$500.
These Standards are enforced on July 1, 2012.
